CodersIncMilestone1

Class Point

  • java.lang.Object
    • CodersIncMilestone1.Point

  • public class Point
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to hold a point from the dataset.
    Version:
    Milestone 1
    Author:
    Gabrielle and Andrew

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Point()
      Point constructor for a point with an undefined value.
      Point(int ptVal)
      Point constructor for a point with a given value.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Point

        public Point(int ptVal)
        Point constructor for a point with a given value.
        Parameters:
        ptVal - The value of the point

      • Point

        public Point()
        Point constructor for a point with an undefined value. Calls the Point(int ptVal) constructor, assigning the point a value of 0.

    • Method Detail

      • addAttribute

        public void addAttribute(java.lang.String att,
                         int value)
        Adds a coordinate pair value to the Point
        Parameters:
        att - The key for the value
        value - The value of the key

      • getAttributes

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAttributes()
        Returns the set of keys that are currently being used by the point.
        Returns:
        A Set of keys in string format.

      • getValue

        public int getValue(java.lang.String att)
        Returns the value of the given key in the point.
        Parameters:
        att - The key of the value to be retrieved
        Returns:
        The value of the key

      • standardise

        public void standardise(java.util.AbstractMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> mean,
                        int n)
        Standardizes the raw values of the point, given the mean values and the number of points in the sample. Uses the formula (x - s)/u, where x is the raw value, s is the value's standard deviation across the sample, and u is the value's average Across the sample.
        Parameters:
        mean - Map of the mean values.
        n - Number of points in the sample.

      • setPointValue

        public void setPointValue(int ptVal)
        Sets the value for this point.
        Parameters:
        ptVal - The new value for the point.

      • getPointValue

        public int getPointValue()
        Returns:
        The point's value.

      • getStdValues

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getStdValues()
        Returns:
        The calculated standard deviation values.

      • setStdValues

        public void setStdValues(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> stdValues)
        Sets the standard deviation values.
        Parameters:
        stdValues - The HashMap containing the new standard deviations.
